title: wanted/required not working
body:
#### What is the problem?
I am trying to sync data in different buckets based on `required` or `wanted` git-annex expression.
For instance setting derivatives subfolder to be hosted in a separate S3 bucket. 

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```
$ datalad siblings -s s3bucket.derivatives --annex-wanted "include='derivatives/*'" configure
.: s3bucket.derivatives(+) [git]

$ datalad add derivatives/hcp_pipelines/sub-06/ses-ana001/T1w/T1w.nii.gz
add(ok): /data/neuromod/DATA/neuromod/neuromod/generic/derivatives/hcp_pipelines/sub-06/ses-ana001/T1w/T1w.nii.gz (file)
                                                                           
save(ok): /data/neuromod/DATA/neuromod/neuromod/generic (dataset)                                              
action summary:                                                              
  add (ok: 1)                                                                                                              
  save (ok: 1)

$ datalad publish --to s3bucket.derivatives
[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/data/neuromod/DATA/neuromod/neuromod/generic> data to s3bucket.derivatives
```
The last command do not produce any error, it start a progress bar, with a ~3GB size to transfer. then stops.

Running the same command with log level debug:

```
$ datalad -l debug publish --to s3bucket.derivatives
[DEBUG  ] Command line args 1st pass. Parsed: Namespace() Unparsed: ['publish', '--to', 's3unf.phantom.anat.derivatives'] 
[DEBUG  ] Discovering plugins 
[DEBUG  ] Building doc for <class 'datalad.interface.annotate_paths.AnnotatePaths'> 
[DEBUG  ] Building doc for <class 'datalad.distribution.publish.Publish'> 
[DEBUG  ] Parsing known args among ['/mnt/data_sq/neuromod/virtualenvs/neuromod_data/bin/datalad', '-l', 'debug', 'publish', '--to', 's3bucket.derivatives'] 
[DEBUG  ] Determined class of decorated function: <class 'datalad.distribution.publish.Publish'> 
[DEBUG  ] Resolved dataset for publishing: <Dataset path=/data/neuromod/DATA/neuromod/neuromod/generic> 
[DEBUG  ] Determined class of decorated function: <class 'datalad.interface.annotate_paths.AnnotatePaths'> 
[DEBUG  ] Evaluating 1 dataset publication candidate(s) 
[DEBUG  ] Attempt to publish 1 datasets 
[DEBUG  ] Remote 's3unf.phantom.anat.derivatives' has no branch matching 'master'. Will publish 
[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/data/neuromod/DATA/neuromod/neuromod/generic> data to s3bucket.derivatives 
[DEBUG  ] Invoking copy --auto 
[DEBUG  ] Determine what files match the query to work with 
[DEBUG  ] Actually copying 278 files 
[DEBUG  ] s3bucket.derivatives is a special annex remote, no git push is needed
```

Is there an overlay in datalad regarding the wanted/required or it is only managed by git-annex?

Thanks!

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
datalad 0.11.6 in a singularity container.
#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
not that I can think of.
#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
Yes! I am just trying to get into more complex use cases now.
